data.text:
Abraham Kerns Arnold: Born Mar.Â 24, 1837, Bedford,Â PA.

Military History. â Cadet at the Military Academy, JulyÂ 1, 1854, to JulyÂ 1, 1859, when he was graduated and promoted in the Army to

Bvt.Â Second Lieut. of Cavalry, JulyÂ 1, 1859.

Served: at the Cavalry School for Practice, Carlisle,Â Pa., 1859â60;

(Second Lieut., 2dÂ Cavalry, JuneÂ 28, 1860)

on frontier duty at Ft.Â Inge,Â Tex. , 1860, â Scouting, 1860, â Ft.Â Inge,Â Tex., 1860â61, â Scouting, 1861, â and Green Lake,Â Tex., 1861; and in garrison at Carlisle Barracks,Â Pa. , 1861.

Served during the Rebellion of the Seceding States, 1861â66: in Operations

(First Lieut., 2dÂ Cavalry, Apr.Â 6, 1861: 5thÂ Cavalry, Aug.Â 3, 1861)

in Shenandoah Valley, May to Aug.,Â 1861, being engaged in the Skirmish at Falling Waters, JulyÂ 4, 1861; as Adjutant, 5thÂ Cavalry, JuneÂ 1, 1861, to MayÂ 9, 1862; in the Defenses of Washington,Â D.Â C., Aug.,Â 1861, to Mar.,Â 1862; in the Virginia Peninsular Campaign (Army of the Potomac), Mar. to July,Â 1862, being engaged in the Siege of Yorktown, Apr.Â 5 to MayÂ 4, 1862, â Action at HanoverÂ C.Â H., JuneÂ 13, 1862, â and Battle of Gaines's Mill, JuneÂ 27, 1862, where he was severely

(Bvt.Â Captain, JuneÂ 27, 1862,

for Gallant and Meritorious Services at the Battle of Gaines's Mill,Â Va.)

wounded; on sick leave of absence, disabled by wounds, JulyÂ 19 to

(Captain, 5thÂ Cavalry, JulyÂ 17, 1862)

Sep.Â 19, 1862; on Recruiting service and Mustering and Disbursing duty at Boston,Â Mas., and NewÂ York city, Sep.Â 19, 1862, to Sep.Â 23, 1863; in command of 5thÂ Cavalry (Army of the Potomac), Oct.Â 10, 1863, to Aug.Â 13, 1864, being engaged in Skirmishes at Bristoe Station,Â Va., Oct.Â 14, and Rixeyville,Â Va., Oct.,Â 1863, â Raid to Charlottesville, Feb.,Â 1864, â Combat at Todd's Tavern, MayÂ 7, 1864, â Skirmish near Spottsylvania

(Bvt.Â Major, MayÂ 6, 1864,

for Gallant and Meritorious Services at the Battle of Todd's Tavern,Â Va.)

C.Â H., MayÂ 8, 1864, â " Sheridan's Raid" to Haxall's Landing, and returning to vicinity of Chatfield Station, MayÂ 9â29, 1864, â Action at Beaver Dam, MayÂ 10, 1864, â Battle of Yellow Tavern, MayÂ 11, 1864, â Combat at Meadow Bridge, MayÂ 12, 1864, â Convoying trains to the White House and the Chickahominy, MayÂ 30 to JuneÂ 7, 1864, â and Battle of Trevillian Station, JuneÂ 11â12, 1864; and on sick leave of absence, Aug.Â 13â23, 1864.

Served: at the Military Academy as Asst.Â Instructor of Cavalry, Aug.Â 23, 1864, to Aug.Â 28, 1869; on leave of absence to Feb.,Â 1870; on

(Major, 6thÂ Cavalry, JuneÂ 22, 1869)

Â p733Â frontier duty at Ft.Â Waco,Â Tex., to June,Â 1870, â Ft.Â Richardson,Â Tex. , and Scouting, Jan.Â 18, 1870, to Apr.Â 19, 1871, â Camp near Ft.Â Hays,Â Kan. , to Oct.,Â 1871, â Ft.Â Riley,Â Kan. , Oct.Â 24, 1871, to May,Â 1872, â and Camp near Ft.Â Hays,Â Kan., to Sep.,Â 1872; in charge of Disbursing Office, Freedmen's Bureau, NewÂ Orleans,Â La., Sep.Â 12, 1872, to July,Â 1878; in settling his accounts, to Nov.Â 5, 1878; and on leave of absence, Nov.Â 5, 1878, to Mar.Â 5, 1879; in command of Ft.Â Grant,Â Ara. , to Nov.Â 29, 1880, being in charge of field operations against hostile Indians in S.Â E.Â Arizona; as Acting Asst. Inspector-General, Department of Arizona, Dec.Â 21, 1880, to Aug.Â 15, 1884, and Acting Asst. Adjutant-General of troops in the field against White Mountain and Chiricahua Indians, Sep.Â 6 to Nov.Â 10, 1881, being engaged with the latter at Cedar Springs,Â Ara.; on frontier duty at Ft.Â Wingate,Â N.Â M. , Aug.Â 17 to Sep.Â 26, 1884, â and at Ft.Â Bayard,Â N.Â M. (commanding post and regiment, Sep.Â 28, 1884, to Mar.Â 15, 1885), to MayÂ 16, 1885; on leave of absence to JulyÂ 15, 1885; in charge of the "Department of War" at the Infantry and Cavalry

(Lieut.âColonel, 1stÂ Cavalry, JuneÂ 11, 1886)
